title: Battery-Ecosystem DID Document
description: Minimal on-chain DID record with role and owner tags plus revocation.

id.description: Decentralized Identifier (DID) for the entity, following the DID syntax.

role.description: Role of the entity in the battery ecosystem, such as EU (End User), OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer), BMS (Battery Management System), Service provider, or Cloud provider.

owner.description: DID of the entity that owns or controls this DID document.

publicKey.description: Public key information used for verifying signatures and authentication.

service.description: Optional array of service endpoints related to the DID subject, such as APIs or metadata services.

created.description: Timestamp indicating when the DID document was created.

updated.description: Timestamp indicating the last update of the DID document.

revoked.description: Boolean flag indicating whether this DID has been revoked.

VerificationMethod.description: A method by which a DID subject can be authenticated, typically using cryptographic keys.

id.description: Identifier for the verification method, typically a DID fragment.

type.description: Type of the verification method, e.g., 'Ed25519VerificationKey2020'.

controller.description: DID that controls this verification method.

publicKeyMultibase.description: The public key encoded in multibase format.

ServiceEndpoint.description: Represents a service associated with the DID subject, such as a metadata or data access point.

id.description: Identifier for the service endpoint, typically a DID fragment.

type.description: Type or category of the service, e.g., 'BatteryDataService'.

serviceEndpoint.description: The actual service endpoint, which can be a URL or a complex object with more detail.
